verses.verse: Then I <S%H7725>returned<s%> and <S%H7200>saw<s%> all the <S%H6217>oppressions<s%> that are <S%H6213>done<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>: <S%H1832>and<s%>, behold, the tears of such as were <S%H6231>oppressed<s%>, and they had no <S%H5162>comforter<s%>; and on the <S%H3027>side<s%> of their <S%H6231>oppressors<s%> there was <S%H3581>power<s%>; but they had no <S%H5162>comforter<s%>.
Wherefore I <S%H7623>praised<s%> the <S%H4191>dead<s%> that have <S%H3528>been<s%> long <S%H4191>dead<s%> more than the <S%H2416>living<s%> that are <S%H5728>yet<s%> <S%H2416>alive<s%>;

yea <S%H2896><s%>, better than them <S%H8147>both<s%> did I esteem him that hath not <S%H5728>yet<s%> <S%H7200>been<s%>, who hath not seen the <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H4639>work<s%> that is <S%H6213>done<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>.

Then I <S%H7200>saw<s%> all <S%H5999>labor<s%> and every <S%H3788>skilful<s%> <S%H4639>work<s%>, that for this a <S%H376>man<s%> is <S%H7068>envied<s%> of his <S%H7453>neighbor<s%>. This also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and a <S%H7469>striving<s%> after <S%H7307>wind<s%>.
Better <S%H2896><s%> is a <S%H3709>handful<s%>, with <S%H5183>quietness<s%>, than <S%H2651>two<s%> <S%H4393>handfuls<s%> with <S%H5999>labor<s%> and <S%H7469>striving<s%> after <S%H7307>wind<s%>.

There <S%H3426>is<s%> <S%H259>one<s%> that is <S%H8145>alone<s%>, and he hath not a second; <S%H1121>yea<s%>, he hath neither son nor <S%H251>brother<s%>; yet is there no <S%H7093>end<s%> of all his <S%H5999>labor<s%>, neither are his <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H7646>satisfied<s%> with <S%H6239>riches<s%>. For whom <S%H6001>then<s%>, saith he, do I labor, and <S%H2637>deprive<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> of <S%H2896>good<s%>? This also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%>, <S%H7451>yea<s%>, it is a sore <S%H6045>travail<s%>.
Two <S%H8147><s%> are <S%H2896>better<s%> than <S%H259>one<s%>, because they <S%H3426>have<s%> a <S%H2896>good<s%> <S%H7939>reward<s%> for their <S%H5999>labor<s%>.

For if they <S%H5307>fall<s%>, the <S%H259>one<s%> will lift <S%H6965>up<s%> his <S%H2270>fellow<s%>; but <S%H337>woe<s%> to him that is <S%H259>alone<s%> when he <S%H5307>falleth<s%>, and hath not <S%H8145>another<s%> to lift him <S%H6965>up<s%>.
Again <S%H1571><s%>, if <S%H8147>two<s%> lie <S%H7901>together<s%>, then they have <S%H2552>warmth<s%>; but how can <S%H259>one<s%> be warm <S%H3179>alone<s%>?

And if a <S%H259>man<s%> <S%H8630>prevail<s%> against him that is <S%H8147>alone<s%>, two shall <S%H5975>withstand<s%> <S%H8027>him<s%>; and a threefold <S%H2339>cord<s%> is not <S%H4120>quickly<s%> <S%H5423>broken<s%>.

Better <S%H2896><s%> is a <S%H4542>poor<s%> and <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H3206>youth<s%> than an <S%H2205>old<s%> and <S%H3684>foolish<s%> <S%H4428>king<s%>, who <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> not how to receive admonition any <S%H2094>more<s%>.
For out of <S%H631>prison<s%> he <S%H3318>came<s%> forth to be <S%H4427>king<s%>; <S%H4438>yea<s%>, even in his kingdom he was <S%H3205>born<s%> <S%H7326>poor<s%>.

I <S%H7200>saw<s%> all the <S%H2416>living<s%> that <S%H1980>walk<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>, that they were with the <S%H3206>youth<s%>, the <S%H8145>second<s%>, that stood up in his <S%H5975>stead<s%>.

There was no <S%H7093>end<s%> of all the <S%H5971>people<s%>, even of all them over whom he <S%H6440>was<s%>: yet they that come <S%H314>after<s%> shall not <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> in <S%H1892>him<s%>. Surely this also is vanity and a <S%H7475>striving<s%> after <S%H7307>wind<s%>.
